column4: hey Seveas, saw you post some (tons) of helpful hints earlier, re: wifi, etc... I'm having some weird connection issues, wondering if u have the time to help....
basically... using the linksys (broadcom 4306) card, i've configured and installed ndiswrapper, wpa_supplicant, etc
card's recognized, seen by system, even sees my wlan, and other surrounding ones, but the connections not stable
try to up the power output of the base station
DukalNamu... card work[ed]  fine under XP, base station output is already at max
i think it's the association... i'm using an airport extreme/ airport express WDS network
then i have a feelling i am going to be in your position in a matter of weeks
then run sudo apt-get install mplayer

yeah, DukGalNamu, i'm not a newbie, so definitely know i've followed the guides, stuff works nicely... my network currently hosts about 6 other machines/ net devices... stuff's configured and working nice, just ubuntu that's not paying ball
DukalNamu... you're going to be using the same card also?
but i have enough trouble networking as it is
have you installed the latest drivers and firmware?
